page.title: 18WILSDEN _ LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Wilsden probably got its name from 'Wilsige' which is a reference to a person who first settled in the area. The 'den' comes from an old English word meaning valley. So Wilsden may have received its name from an early name meaning 'Wilsige's valley'. Wilsden is very old and was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. Most people were farmers then. Around 1810 mills were built and the village grew as a result of this industrial development. Now most people who live in the village work elsewhere, such as the nearby cities of Bradford and Leeds. Wilsden also is a twinned village. Recently it became twinned with Eppeville in France.
